intro: Matelea oblongifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf morning glory, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Convolvulaceae, which includes many vine-like plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning.
